p: On the basis of the existing literature, COVID-19 can be defined as an acute respiratory syndrome that affects primarily the lungs, causing pneumonia that can progress to a more severe stage; that is, acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), multiorgan failure, and even death [ 31]. Lungs were considered the main target for SARS-CoV-2 infection, but other injured organs were also described after encounter with the virus, such as esophagus, small intestine, colon, stomach, kidney, and testis, on the account of the ACE2 receptors that are expressed at their level [ 31].
